common.authRequired: Your session has expired. Please sign in again.
common.forbidden: You do not have permission to perform this action.
common.serviceUnavailable: Service temporarily unavailable. Please try again.

hero.title: Your Passwords.
hero.subtitle: The secure open-source password manager with end-to-end encryption. Your data belongs only to you.

security.title: Highest Security Standards
security.subtitle: We go beyond industry standard encryption - with post-quantum protection, duress passwords, and tamper detection.

zeroKnowledge.title: Zero-Knowledge Architecture
zeroKnowledge.description: We can never see your passwords. Decryption happens only on your device.

e2ee.title: End-to-End Encryption
e2ee.description: AES-256-GCM encryption with Argon2id (128 MiB) key derivation - stronger than industry standard.

openSource.title: 100% Open Source
openSource.description: The entire codebase is publicly available and auditable by the community.

clientSide.title: Client-Side Encryption
clientSide.description: All data is encrypted BEFORE being sent to the server.

postQuantum.title: Post-Quantum Encryption
postQuantum.description: Security Standard v1 enforces ML-KEM-768 + RSA-4096 hybrid key exchange for Emergency Access and Shared Collections (NIST FIPS 203).

passkeyUnlock.title: Passkey Vault Unlock
passkeyUnlock.description: Unlock your vault with biometrics or a security key using the WebAuthn PRF extension - no password needed.

duressPassword.title: Panic Password
duressPassword.description: A secondary password opens a decoy vault with fake data - protection when forced to reveal your password.

vaultIntegrity.title: Vault Integrity Verification
vaultIntegrity.description: Merkle-tree based tamper detection ensures no one has modified your vault data server-side.

passwordManager.title: Password Manager
passwordManager.description: Store all your passwords securely in one place.

generator.title: Password Generator
generator.description: Create strong, unique passwords with one click.

categories.title: Categories & Tags
categories.description: Organize your entries with folders and labels.

crossPlatform.title: Cross-Platform
crossPlatform.description: Works on all devices - desktop, tablet, and mobile.

openSource.title: Transparent & Open Source
openSource.subtitle: Trust through transparency
openSource.description: Singra PW is fully open source. Every line of code can be reviewed by the community. No hidden backdoors, no secrets.

comparison.title: Why Singra PW?
comparison.subtitle: A fact-based comparison with leading password managers. All data verified from official sources (Feb 2026).
comparison.disclaimer: All information is based on publicly available documentation from the respective providers, verified in February 2026. Feature availability may change. Bitwarden: bitwarden.com/help | 1Password: 1password.com | LastPass: lastpass.com

pwa.title: How Does the PWA Work?
pwa.subtitle: Singra PW is a Progressive Web App – a modern web application that works like a native app and is also available offline.

whatIsPwa.title: What is a PWA?
whatIsPwa.description: A Progressive Web App combines the best of web and native apps. You can install it directly from your browser – no app store needed – and it behaves like a real app on your device.

offlineAccess.title: Offline Access
offlineAccess.description: Once you've logged in online, you can access your stored passwords even without an internet connection. Your data is cached locally in an encrypted format.

installable.title: Installable
installable.description: Install Singra PW on your home screen for quick access. In Chrome/Edge: Menu → 'Install app'. On iOS: Share → 'Add to Home Screen'.

autoSync.title: Automatic Sync
autoSync.description: Changes you make offline are automatically synchronized when you're back online. No data is lost.

localEncryption.title: Local Encryption Stays Active
localEncryption.description: Even offline, all your data is stored encrypted with AES-256-GCM. Your master password is still required to unlock the vault.

offlineCache.title: Encrypted Offline Cache
offlineCache.description: The local cache in IndexedDB contains only encrypted data. Without your master password, the data is unreadable – even if someone gains access to your device.

firstLogin.title: First Login Requires Internet
firstLogin.content: An internet connection is required for the first login and setting up your master password. After that, you can access your vault offline.

masterPassword.title: Master Password Always Required
masterPassword.content: Even in offline mode, you must enter your master password. This is an important security feature – without the password, your data remains encrypted.

offlineChanges.title: Offline Changes Are Saved
offlineChanges.content: When you create new entries or edit existing ones offline, they are saved locally and automatically synchronized when you're back online.

browserSupport.title: Browser Compatibility
browserSupport.content: PWA features are supported by all modern browsers (Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari). For the best experience, we recommend Chrome or Edge on desktop and Safari on iOS.

footer.copyright: © {{year}} Singra PW. Source Available under BSL 1.1 License.

securityWhitepaper.title: Security Whitepaper
securityWhitepaper.subtitle: A factual description of the security architecture – derived directly from the codebase and DB policies.
securityWhitepaper.disclaimer: Note: This page describes the implementation (code) – not an external audit. 100% security does not exist, but we document transparently what we do and what we do not.

quickFacts.title: Quick facts
quickFacts.subtitle: What to know at a glance
items: Vault item contents are encrypted client-side before storage/transmission.
Key derivation: Argon2id with KDF versions v1 (64 MiB) and v2 (128 MiB).
AES-GCM CryptoKeys are non-extractable; raw bytes are best-effort zeroed after import.
RLS is enabled on relevant tables; policies restrict access to auth.uid().

zeroKnowledge.title: Zero-knowledge (vault items)
zeroKnowledge.summary: Sensitive vault content is stored server-side as ciphertext; decryption happens in the client.
bullets: Vault items are stored as encrypted_data; title/URL metadata is intentionally not stored in plaintext (placeholder + null).
Create/import encrypts before writing to the database; the server never receives vault-item plaintext.
Note: Some structural metadata (e.g., category/tag/collection names) remains plaintext DB fields.

cryptography.title: Cryptography & KDF
cryptography.summary: AES-256-GCM for data; Argon2id for key derivation; KDF is migrated to stronger parameters when needed.
bullets: AES-GCM: 96-bit IV, 128-bit auth tag; output format is base64(IV || ciphertext || tag).
Fixed KDF versions: v1 = 64 MiB, v2 = 128 MiB (Argon2id).
KDF auto-migration after successful unlock: upgrade may be skipped on OOM to stay device-compatible.

memory.title: Keys & memory clearing
memory.summary: Best-effort: raw key bytes are zeroed; lock removes key references. JavaScript has limits.
bullets: Raw bytes derived from Argon2id are overwritten via Uint8Array.fill(0) after CryptoKey import (best-effort).
Vault lock removes references to encryptionKey/integrityKey and clears session indicators.
SecureBuffer exists as defense-in-depth (explicit destroy() + FinalizationRegistry fallback), but JS/GC cannot guarantee memory wiping.
Strings (e.g., decrypted passwords) cannot be wiped in-place in JS; we can only drop references and rely on GC.

clipboard.title: Clipboard protection
clipboard.summary: Copied secrets are auto-cleared after 30 seconds – only if the user hasn't overwritten them.
bullets: writeClipboard() schedules auto-clear after 30s.
Only clears if clipboard still equals last written value (won't clobber user content).
Limitation: clipboard APIs can be restricted by browser permissions/focus.

rls.title: Database access (Supabase RLS)
rls.summary: Row Level Security is enabled; policies allow only own rows or explicit memberships.
bullets: Owner model: many tables use auth.uid() = user_id (e.g., vault_items, file_attachments, categories, tags).
Emergency access: trustees get SELECT on vault_items only when status='granted' and grantor_id matches.
Shared collections: access via owner_id or membership in shared_collection_members; policy is implemented without recursion.

attachments.title: File attachments
attachments.summary: File contents and metadata are encrypted client-side; DB/RLS restricts access to the owner.
bullets: Upload stores encrypted content in Supabase Storage (application/octet-stream).
File metadata (name/MIME) is stored additionally as encrypted_metadata; plaintext columns are intended as opaque placeholders.
DB RLS policies enforce access only for auth.uid() = user_id.

sharing.title: Sharing (collections & emergency access)
sharing.summary: Sharing is based on DB membership/roles plus asymmetric cryptography for key wrapping.
bullets: Shared collections use owner/member + permission (view/edit) in shared_collection_members.
Emergency access controls trustee access via status and grantor/trustee linkage.
Asymmetric crypto (RSA-OAEP 4096) is provided in the crypto service for sharing/emergency flows.

offline.title: Offline mode
offline.summary: Offline snapshots + mutation queue live in IndexedDB and sync back when online.
bullets: OfflineVaultSnapshot stores per-user snapshots (items, categories) and queued mutations.
Offline unlock stores salt + verifier in snapshot (no plaintext master password).
Limitation: browser storage can be wiped; integrity depends on a local baseline.

integrity.title: Tamper detection (integrity root)
integrity.summary: HMAC Merkle tree over (itemId | encrypted_data); root is stored client-side.
bullets: Protects against a compromised server that deletes/replaces/replays ciphertext.
Integrity key is derived separately from the encryption key (domain separation).
Limitations are explicitly documented (e.g., no protection against stale reads without additional mechanisms).

headers.title: Browser hardening (headers/CSP)
headers.summary: Vite serves CSP + security headers (prod stricter than dev).
bullets: Prod CSP: script-src 'self' (no inline/eval) + frame-ancestors 'none'.
X-Frame-Options=DENY, X-Content-Type-Options=nosniff, strict Referrer/Permissions-Policy.
Limitation: CSP is defense-in-depth, not a standalone XSS solution.

limitations.title: Limits & threat model
limitations.summary: Transparency: what risks remain (as with any web password manager).
bullets: If delivered client code is compromised (supply chain/XSS), it can steal secrets during unlock.
Malware on the device or a compromised browser can read the vault while unlocked.
Metadata trade-offs: some table fields are plaintext (e.g., categories.name, tags.name, shared_collections.name).

references.title: Further references
references.subtitle: General standards/guides that inform our decisions

links.owaspCsp: OWASP Content Security Policy Cheat Sheet

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: Transparency and security are our top priorities. Learn how we protect your data.

zeroKnowledge.title: Zero-Knowledge Architecture
zeroKnowledge.description: Your data belongs only to you.
zeroKnowledge.details:
Singra PW is built on a Zero-Knowledge principle. This means your passwords and sensitive data are encrypted exclusively on your device before ever being stored or transmitted. We as operators have technically no way to view your decrypted data. Your Master Password never leaves your device.

Transparency note: In the current web architecture, 100% absolute Zero-Knowledge is not fully possible because some technical metadata must remain processable on the server (for example IDs, timestamps, ownership references, and session/authentication state). We minimize this metadata, encrypt all sensitive vault content and major vault metadata, and continuously reduce plaintext wherever technically feasible.

general.title: General
general.content: This privacy policy explains the nature, scope, and purpose of the processing of personal data within our online offering.

collection.title: Data Collection
collection.content:
We collect only what is necessary to provide the service:

- Email address (for authentication and account recovery)
- Encrypted vault data (we cannot read the content)
- Encrypted vault metadata (e.g. item title, URL, type, favorite flag, category reference)
- Master Password Hash (for verification, not the password itself)
- Encrypted 2FA/TOTP secret (for two-factor authentication)
- Authentication metadata (login time)

Vault Health note: For the analysis feature, passwords are evaluated locally after decryption in your active session (e.g. strength, age, and reuse checks). No additional persistent server-side storage of plaintext passwords is performed.

security.title: Security Measures
security.content:
To protect your data, we use state-of-the-art encryption technologies:

- AES-256-GCM for data encryption
- Argon2id for key derivation
- Client-side encryption for vault content and vault metadata
- Server-side encryption for stored 2FA/TOTP secrets
- HTTPS/TLS for all transmissions

All cryptographic operations for vault data take place locally in your browser.

storage.title: Data Storage
storage.content: Your encrypted data is securely stored in our cloud database (Supabase). Backups are created regularly and are also encrypted.

cookies.title: Cookies & Local Data
cookies.content: We use local storage technologies (LocalStorage and IndexedDB) to store your settings (e.g., theme, language), session information, and encrypted offline vault cache for PWA use. We do not use third-party tracking cookies.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.content:
You have the right at any time to:

• Information about your stored data
• Correction of incorrect data
• Deletion of your account and all data
• Export of your data in a machine-readable format

banner.title: We respect your privacy
banner.description: We use cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website. Some are essential, others help us improve the user experience.

settings.title: Cookie Settings
settings.description: Here you can decide which cookies you want to allow.

necessary.title: Necessary
necessary.description: These cookies are essential for the website to function (e.g. login status). They cannot be disabled.

optional.title: Optional (Preferences)
optional.description: Preferences like Theme (Light/Dark), Language, and Auto-Lock Timer. If disabled, these settings will not be saved permanently.

login.title: Welcome back
login.subtitle: Sign in to access your vault

signup.title: Create account
signup.subtitle: Create your secure account in a few steps
signup.passwordRequirements: At least 12 characters with uppercase/lowercase, numbers, and special characters

masterPassword.title: Create Master Password
masterPassword.subtitle: This password encrypts all your data. It is never sent to our servers.
masterPassword.warning: If you forget your master password, we cannot recover your data!

unlock.title: Unlock Vault
unlock.subtitle: Enter your master password to access your data
unlock.sessionRestore: Please re-enter your master password to continue your session.

settings.title: Settings

account.title: Account
account.description: Manage your account and login credentials.
account.deleteConfirmDesc: This action cannot be undone. All your data, passwords, and settings will be permanently deleted.
account.deleteSuccessDesc: Your account and all data have been deleted.

security.title: Security
security.description: Control the security settings of your vault.
security.autoLockDesc: The vault will automatically lock after inactivity. Note: Reloading the page always requires re-entering your master password for security reasons.
security.vaultLockedDesc: Your vault has been successfully locked.

twoFactor.title: Two-Factor Authentication
twoFactor.description: Add an extra layer of security to your account using an authenticator app.
twoFactor.disabledDesc: Your account is not protected by two-factor authentication.

setup.step1Desc: Open your authenticator app (Google Authenticator, Authy, etc.) and scan this QR code.
setup.step2Desc: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app to verify the setup.
setup.step3Desc: Save these backup codes in a safe place. You can use them if you lose access to your authenticator app.
setup.codesWarning: Each code can only be used once. Store them securely and do not share them.

disableDialog.title: Disable Two-Factor Authentication
disableDialog.description: Enter the current code from your authenticator app to disable 2FA.
disableDialog.backupCodeNotAllowed: Backup codes cannot be used to disable 2FA. Please use your authenticator app.

vault.title: Require 2FA for Vault
vault.description: Require authenticator code in addition to master password when unlocking the vault.

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.description: Customize the look and feel of the application.

data.title: Data
data.description: Export or import your vault data.
data.exportDesc: Export all your passwords and entries as a JSON file.
data.importDesc: Import entries from a JSON export file.
data.importConfirmDesc: The entries will be added to your existing vault.
data.importFailed: Import failed. Make sure the file is valid.

support.title: Support
support.description: Create support tickets and track response times.
support.slaDisclaimer: Response times are target values (in the usual case), not guaranteed response deadlines.
support.securityHint: Never send your master password, recovery codes, private keys, or vault content via support messages.
support.subject: Subject
support.messagePlaceholder: Describe your issue in detail (steps, errors, expected result).
support.validation: Please enter at least 3 characters for subject and 10 characters for message.
support.averageResponse30d: Average first response time (30 days): {{hours}} h

chat.title: Chat
chat.newReplyBody: You received a new reply on your support ticket.

danger.title: Danger Zone
danger.deleteWarning: This action cannot be undone. All your data will be permanently deleted.

family.title: Family Organization
family.description: Invite and manage up to 6 premium family members.
family.inviteSent: Invitation sent. If this email is not registered yet, they can sign up first and then accept it.

sharedCollections.title: Shared Collections
sharedCollections.description: Create collections for sharing vault items with family members.
sharedCollections.masterPasswordDescription: To create your first shared collection, we need to provision hybrid key material for your account.
sharedCollections.masterPasswordRequired: Master password is required to provision key material.
sharedCollections.rotateKeyWarning: All items will be re-encrypted. This may take some time.

admin.title: Admin Area
admin.description: Internal operations for support, team roles, and permission management.
admin.accessDeniedDescription: You don't have permission to access the internal admin area.

support.title: Support Inbox

support.selectTicket: Select a ticket on the left.

team.title: Team & Permissions
team.noAccess: You don't have permission to manage roles or permissions.
team.membersDescription: Manage internal roles for team members.
team.permissionsDescription: Manage role permissions without code deployment.

emergency.title: Emergency Access
emergency.description: Manage who can access your vault in emergencies.
emergency.inviteDesc: Enter the email of the person you want to trust with emergency access.

emergency.inviteAccepted: Invitation accepted. Key pair generated and stored.
emergency.fetchError: Failed to load emergency access data.
emergency.noGrantors: You are not a trusted contact for anyone.
emergency.waitTimeDetail: How long after a request before access is granted.
emergency.setupError: Failed to configure access. Check your password.
emergency.confirmSetupDesc: Enter your master password to encrypt your vault key for this contact.
emergency.noKey: No master key found. Setup not complete.

subscription.premium_description: Advanced security and features for power users.
subscription.families_description: Secure passwords for the whole family.

support.families_sla: Priority support - usually within 24h (owner + all active family members)
support.sla_note: Support response times are target values in the usual case.

subscription.free_security_note: AES-256-GCM + Argon2id included for all users
subscription.legal_info: All prices include VAT. Subscriptions renew automatically unless canceled before the end of the billing period.
subscription.refund_info: Refunds are handled individually through our support team.
subscription.checkout_description: You will be redirected to Stripe to subscribe to {{plan}}.

subscription.widerruf_consent_loss: I acknowledge that I will lose my right of withdrawal upon full contract execution.

subscription.cancel_effect_access: You keep Premium access until the end of the current period.
subscription.cancel_effect_features: After that, you will automatically switch to the FREE plan.
subscription.cancel_effect_data: Your stored data will be preserved.

passkey.title: Passkeys
passkey.description: Use biometrics or a security key to unlock your vault without typing your master password.
passkey.infoText: Passkeys use the PRF extension to derive an encryption key from your authenticator. Your master password remains as a fallback and can always unlock the vault.
passkey.noPlatformAuth: No platform authenticator detected. You can still use a security key (e.g. YubiKey).
passkey.passwordRequired: Master password is required to register a passkey.
passkey.passwordHint: Required to securely link the passkey to your vault encryption key.
passkey.registeredWithPrf: Passkey registered! You can now unlock your vault with this passkey.
passkey.registeredWithoutPrf: Passkey registered for authentication, but this device does not support vault unlock (no PRF). You will still need your master password.
passkey.deleteDescription: This will permanently remove "{{name}}". You will no longer be able to unlock your vault with this passkey. Your master password will still work.
passkey.unlockFailed: Passkey unlock failed. Please try your master password.

postQuantum.title: Post-Quantum Encryption
postQuantum.description: Security Standard v1 enforces hybrid post-quantum key protection (ML-KEM-768 + RSA-4096) for shared and emergency key exchange.
postQuantum.infoText: Security Standard v1 combines ML-KEM-768 and RSA-4096 in one hybrid key path to reduce 'harvest now, decrypt later' risk while keeping compatibility for vault payload encryption.
postQuantum.enableDescription: Hybrid key material is provisioned automatically when sharing or emergency access requires it.
postQuantum.enableSuccess: Post-quantum encryption has been enabled successfully!
postQuantum.premiumRequired: Post-quantum encryption requires a Premium or Families subscription.

duress.title: Panic Password
duress.description: Set up a secondary password that opens a decoy vault instead of your real one.
duress.howItWorksDescription: A panic password (also called duress password) is a secondary password that, when entered, shows a fake vault with decoy items instead of your real data. This protects you if you're forced to reveal your password (e.g., at border control or under threat).
duress.warning: Important: Never share your panic password with anyone. If an adversary learns both passwords, this protection is ineffective.
duress.unlockRequired: Unlock your vault to manage panic password settings.
duress.premiumRequired: Panic password requires a Premium or Families subscription.
duress.setupDescription: Create a secondary password that will show a decoy vault. Make sure it's different from your real master password but still easy to remember.
duress.masterPasswordRequired: Master password is required to verify your identity
duress.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters
duress.differentPasswordWarning: Your panic password must be different from your master password. Choose something plausible but distinct.
duress.setupSuccessDescription: You can now use your panic password to show a decoy vault.
duress.setupFailed: Failed to set up panic password
duress.disableDescription: This will remove your panic password. Your decoy vault items will become inaccessible.
duress.disableWarning: After disabling, you will no longer be able to access decoy vault items. This action cannot be undone.
duress.disableSuccessDescription: Your panic password has been removed.
duress.changeDescription: Enter your current panic password and choose a new one.
duress.changeSuccessDescription: Your panic password has been updated.

integrity.title: Vault Integrity
integrity.description: Tamper detection for your vault data
integrity.tamperDescription: Your vault data may have been tampered with. Items may have been added, modified, or deleted without your knowledge. Please review your vault contents carefully.
integrity.passkeyNote: Integrity verification is not available for passkey unlock sessions.
